Posted By: Curlie-Joe (4/25/2013 1:48:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think the one thing that's majorly different between this and cloak is that no matter who controls the creature, you gain the life for cloak.  
  
It kind of creates a pseudo-"[Vow of](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vow of)" aura. If you are low on life, you can attach it onto an opponents creature and you'll still gain life. If they attack you, you'd gain the life they just dealt you. Mind you, if they deal lethal, you're up s\*\*t's creek.  
  
I guess the other thing is that this doesn't stack with lifelink. Cloak's ability is a triggered ability, while lifelink's a static ability.
posts.html:
I think the one thing that's majorly different between this and cloak is that no matter who controls the creature, you gain the life for cloak.

It kind of creates a pseudo-"Vow of" aura. If you are low on life, you can attach it onto an opponents creature and you'll still gain life. If they attack you, you'd gain the life they just dealt you. Mind you, if they deal lethal, you're up s**t's creek.

I guess the other thing is that this doesn't stack with lifelink. Cloak's ability is a triggered ability, while lifelink's a static ability.

posts.post_content: [Armadillo Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armadillo Cloak) is better than this card, but not for the reason you might think: the Cloak isn't affiliated with the Selesnya Conclave, which automatically makes it better. That said, I can't argue against this card's utility, and it'll do if you can't get your hands on its superior predecessor.

Posted By: TheWallinator74 (4/28/2014 8:50:01 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: In my opinion, [Armadillo Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armadillo Cloak) revisited is the most underrated card in Standard right now. Selesnya Aura is a beatdown - throw out a Gladecover Scouts for hexproof safety, mix in [Ethereal Armor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ethereal Armor), and finally the most underrated card from Born of the Gods, [Eidolon of Countless Battles](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eidolon of Countless Battles), with Unflinching Courage attached, you have yourself an 8/8 hexproof, trample, lifelink, first strike on turn 4. This combo took down a local MTG tourney - [Selesyna Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Selesyna Charm) added works wonders to eliminate Gods, or splash in a 2/2 that can be sacrificed if a sudden [Devour Flesh](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Devour Flesh) arrives.
posts.html:
